duties_responsibilities.duty: Evaluates MRP reports for scheduling raw materials and coordinates delivery with suppliers.
Approves suppliers based on company qualifications and maintains quality file system.
Manages the purchasing systems for defective materials and resolves dispositioned materials with suppliers.
Seeks out the best sources of supply based on price, quantity, service, and reliability and negotiates pricing and payment terms.
Conducts analysis on potential savings or increased efficiency, and plans inventory cycle from Customer Order through Supplier relationships to shipment.
Coordinates logistics for incoming and outgoing shipments, manages customer relationships, and participates in customer and supplier meetings.
Prepares reports and presentations to institute change, and acts as a subject matter expert for the Supply Chain Department.
Travel to suppliers, direct department activities, and uphold company core values.
Determine which vendors to use for orders, ideal inventory levels, and best-in-class frameworks, systems, and processes.
Design processes for streamlining work and analyze potential areas for savings or efficiencies.
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, draw valid conclusions, and interpret technical instructions.
Ability to read, analyze, interpret scientific and technical journals, financial reports, and effectively present information to management, public groups, or boards of directors.
Ability to calculate figures, apply basic algebra and geometry, and communicate effectively in negotiations and relationship building.
Strong understanding of regulated industries, medical device manufacturers, and world-class manufacturing principles.

education_certification.credential: Master's Degree or MBA degree required, 4+ years related experience
